dynamiccrosshair.title: Dynamic Crosshair
dynamiccrosshair.option.dynamicCrosshair:
Hides the crosshair unless holding a tool, weapon, or targeting an entity.
Simple mode is less accurate, but more performant.
dynamiccrosshair.option.disableDebugCros: Replace the axis crosshair when the F3 debug screen is open with the standard (dynamic) crosshair.
dynamiccrosshair.option.thirdPersonCross: Don't hide the crosshair when in third person view. This only applies to the back perspective, not the front one.
dynamiccrosshair.option.hideWithScreen: Hide whenever a screen is open
dynamiccrosshair.option.hideWithScreen.d: Hide whenever a screen is open
dynamiccrosshair.option.hideWithMap.desc: Hide whenever a map is being held in both hands, so it does not get obstructed by the crosshair
dynamiccrosshair.option.dynamicCrosshair:
When enabled, use context dependent styles.
When disabled, the crosshair will always be the vanilla one, but can still be hidden based on the settings below.
dynamiccrosshair.group.crosshairConfig.d: Configure under which circumstances the crosshair should be visible. It will be hidden in all other cases.
Looking at block

Show the crosshair given the following condition:
If Targeting: when any block is targeted.
If Interactable: when the targeted block can be interacted with.
Disabled: does not show based on block target; may still use the targeted block to evaluate held items.
Looking at entity
Show the crosshair whenever an entity is targeted.
Holding tool

Show the crosshair given the following condition:
Always: when a tool is being held.
If Targeting: when a tool is being held and a block is targeted.
Disabled: do not use held tools for crosshair computation.
Melee weapon overrides tool
Prioritize the melee weapon crosshair over the tool one for tools which can be used as weapons, such as axes.
Tool/weapon overrides entity
Show tool or weapon crosshair when targeting an entity depending on held item. Always show entity crosshair if off.
Breakable Block overrides weapon
Shows the "correct tool" crosshair when targeting an instantly breakable block using a melee weapon like a sword.
Holding ranged weapon

Show ranged weapon crosshair given the following condition:
Always: when a ranged weapon is being held.
If Interactable: when the held ranged weapon is ready to fire.
Disabled: do not use held ranged weapons for crosshair computation.
Holding throwable item

Show throwable item crosshair given the following condition:
Always: when a throwable item is being held.
If Interactable: when the held throwable item is ready to throw; but not when there's a cooldown.
Disabled: do not use held throwable items for crosshair computation.
Holding shield
Show shield crosshair when holding a shield.
Holding block

Show block crosshair under the following condition:
§lAlways§r: when a block is being held.
§lIf Targeting§r: when a block is being held and a block is targeted.
§lIf Interactable§r: when the held block can be placed at the targeted location.
§lDisabled§r: do not use held blocks for crosshair computation.
Holding usable item

Show usable item crosshair under the following condition:
Always: when a usable item (such as food) is being held.
If Interactable: when the held usable item can be currently used.
Disabled: do not use held usable items for crosshair computation.
Force holding spyglass
Force showing a crosshair while holding a spyglass.
dynamiccrosshair.option.crosshairStyle.s: Sets the style of the crosshair. Different crosshairs can have different styles.
dynamiccrosshair.option.crosshairStyle.c: Set the color of the crosshair. "Unchanged" inherits color from vanilla.
Set a custom color for the crosshair. The format is #AARRGGBB (alpha, red, green, blue).
This disables the crosshair from inverting colors when over certain textures
dynamiccrosshair.group.crosshairStyle.re: General crosshair when no others apply.
dynamiccrosshair.group.crosshairStyle.on: Crosshair when targeting a block. Item specific crosshairs override this depending on Behavior settings.
Crosshair when targeting an Entity. Item specific crosshairs override this depending on Behavior settings.
dynamiccrosshair.group.crosshairStyle.ho: Crosshair when holding a tool. This is active depending on Behavior settings.
Crosshair when holding a melee weapon. This is active depending on Behavior settings.
Crosshair when holding a ranged weapon. This is active depending on Behavior settings.
Crosshair when holding a throwable item. This is active depending on Behavior settings.
Crosshair when holding a placeable block. This is active depending on Behavior settings.
Crosshair when holding a usable item. This is active depending on Behavior settings.
dynamiccrosshair.group.crosshairModifier: Crosshair modifier when targeting an interactable block. This is active depending on Behavior settings.
Crosshair modifier when holding the correct tool. This is active depending on Behavior settings.
Crosshair modifier when holding the wrong tool. This is active depending on Behavior settings.
Crosshair modifier when holding a usable item. This is active depending on Behavior settings.
Crosshair modifier when holding a shield. This is active depending on Behavior settings.
dynamiccrosshair.option.enableTweaks: Enable the tweaks on this page
dynamiccrosshair.option.enableTweaks.des: The tweaks on this page can be used to configure crosshair behaviour on servers where behaviour changes cannot be detected. You can use this toggle to turn them off when playing single player or on other servers.
A list of item names or tags, such as "minecraft:fire_charge". These items will be added to the tools category.
dynamiccrosshair.option.additionalMeleeW: A list of item names or tags, such as "minecraft:fire_charge". These items will be added to the melee weapons category.
dynamiccrosshair.option.additionalRanged: A list of item names or tags, such as "minecraft:fire_charge". These items will be added to the ranged weapons category.
dynamiccrosshair.option.additionalThrowa: A list of item names or tags, such as "minecraft:fire_charge". These items will be added to the throwable items category.
dynamiccrosshair.option.additionalUsable: A list of item names or tags, such as "minecraft:fire_charge". These items will be added to the usable items category.
dynamiccrosshair.option.additionalIntera: A list of block names or tags, such as "minecraft:oak_log" or "#minecraft:stairs". These blocks will be added to the interactable blocks category.
